Reviews.Title: “Reasonable Price & Decent Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: mysticrhythm
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for two days including New Years Eve. The room was decent and housekeeping was very professional. Nothing spectacular about the room except it was clean. The mattress was kinda of worn but carpet and linen was of good quality. The front desk was much better at check out than check in, especially after they forced us to add money for additional person for us to get our "guaranteed" double bed room. They were going to move us to a King bed even though it was my brother and myself staying. Oh well, just be careful of markup. Also, ice machine/vending was not conveniently located as we expected. Lastly, we very much enjoyed the area and its convenient access to the #7 train. Being in the Chinese section of Flushings, we sincerely enjoyed the best Chinese food we ever had!!! We wish we were closer to Manhattan but its only about 35 minutes out via train. We will stay again due to price and convenience of the train but will explore other options if its cheaper/closer.

Reviews.Title: “Basic 'you get what you pay for' hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mapHongKong
Reviews.Content: Safe, Chinese dominated area with range of OK oriental dominated restaurants. Close to good subway link into Manhattan, and La Guardia Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and well located”
Reviews.Author: Danster123
Reviews.Content: Not much you can't say about the hotel as it's a Best Western and you really couldn't expect too much from them. The hotel is only a few blocks from train station so it's very convenient getting around town. The room is not big and renovation is needed as it's pretty old. The bed were comfortable and it's not the cleanest hotel I had been to but the price is very reasonable for a short trip to New York.

Reviews.Title: “It's a OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: amymm2006
Reviews.Content: I like the location, it's very continent to train, surrounded by lots of restaurants, shops. The room is small and the facilities are old. I didn't see much service at all. They don't have parking space, there is a parking lot across the street. It's $15/night. I think it's a little bit of noisy during the night.

Reviews.Title: “No problems”
Reviews.Author: demun
Reviews.Content: This hotel was better than I expected based on some of the reviews. I needed an inexpensive hotel for a meeting in Manhattan and this was the closest I could find. It's only a couple of blocks from the subway, with a direct connection to Times Square, so it was easy to get to my meeting in the morning. It's a good location is you like Asian food. Pretty much every restaurant in the area is Asian. My room was clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a good experience”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller7505
Reviews.Content: I was misleaded by the good reviews for this hotel. We had a VERY POOR experience here, all the way from no hotel parking ( we had to park our car in the parking lot infront of the hotel), very busy area with heavy traffic, poor wi-fi connection ( we could barely use internet). Even the TV picture was not clear, the breakfast buffet was the worst I ever experienced, very cheap and limited varieties. The ONLY positive thing about the hotel is that it's a 5 min walk to the MTA subway. I absolutely do not recommend this hotel, unless you have family/friends in that Chinatown area and would like to stay close to them.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel in Flushing downtown close to delicious eateries”
Reviews.Author: Katong
Reviews.Content: Small hotel but decent sized room with 2 queen size beds. Located in Flushing downtown close to nice Chinese eateries and less than 5 mins walk to metro. Can catch no 7 train straight to Times Sq. Macy's Flushing is near to the metro. Area is always bustling, and we feel safe even at night. Just around the corner from the hotel is a good Xiao Loong Pao restaurant which make one of the best Shanghai dumpling we have ever tasted even in Asia. Restaurant is always packed. Service at hotel is minimal, which suits us fine as we don't need help with luggage and don't order room service. What is important is clean room and bathroom. Receptionists were quite helpful. Helped to amend my non refundable booking for free and provide direction to a good pediatrician when my daughter fell sick. Breakfast is not bad. Although it says continental, you can get boiled eggs, waffle, toasts, cereals and fresh fruits.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_for_30_yrs
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel. I booked it on the phone with a Best Western representative after confirmation that the hotel I wanted was full. I knew the hotel was not as close to Manhattan as I would have liked to be but that was what was available when we booked. When we arrived we had a shock because we thought we were in a chinese city suburb. Not too many english signs around. After the initial shock, we took possession of the room and discover an excellent service and a very clean room. The personnel at the front desk was always very nice and cooperative and speak english but the working personnel on the floors did not speak english which was a not an important inconvenient. Most of the clientele is chinese from all part of the world but approching the week-end, the clientele was more diversified as they were people touring NYC for a week-end. Everyday the room was cleaned to our satisfaction. We had read about the bed bugs epidemy in NYC but this place was free of any bugs. There is a parking across the street for $15/day so the car was never far from the hotel and our sight. The area was safe as long as you would stay in the chinese area. The subway station was 5 minutes away on foot as well as the train station. 30-35 min by subway to downtown and 15-20 min by train (safer at night). Continental breakfast was OK but nothing special about it. There was one only person taking care of the breakfast room but she was not there all the time. If she had been there all the time, we would have had a better service at breakfast. There was always something missing. Interesting restaurants in the area if you like asian food. Shopping too is interesting and you can find good bargains. It is worth to have a walk in the area. It gives a flavor of the chinese world. You do not feel you are in NYC. I recommend this hotel. It is close to highways and easy to access. Easy access too to NYC downtown. If one day you do not want to go downtown, you can easily visit state beaches of Long Island. Very clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive in Flushing”
Reviews.Author: Rillifane
Reviews.Content: Choices for hotels in Flushing which has become a center for Asian immigration are limited. Over the last six months I've found it necessary to be in this area several times and balked at the prices at the nearby Sheraton. The Best Western, on the next block, has proven to be good value. The rooms are reasonably sized, clean, and comfortable and, at less than $150/night, reasonably price for New York. The hotel is just a short walk to the Main Street-Roosevelt avenue stop of Subway line #7 which will get you into Manhattan in 39 minutes. This area is the new "Chinatown" and Asian restaurants of every type and description fill every available commercial space. Being myself of mixed Anglo-Asian descent I find it a culinary paradise. For those with different tastes or background it may be a bit daunting since there is little concession made for American tastes or English only speakers. The hotel has free WiFi and the front desk can print documents and send faxes for you. There is a small fitness center available. Beyond this there are few of the amenities one might like. The Cable TV service is very limited and, because the clientele is largely Asian many of the available channels are in Asian languages. There are two small vending machines in the basement that often seemed to malfunction. What once was a bar and grill in the hotel is closed and gives no sign of being re-opened any time soon. The breakfast provided free of additional charge is meager and served in a depressing back room facing an alley. On the other hand the staff is wonderfully polite, friendly and helpful. When a fax I sent elicited a response written in Chinese, a language I speak haltingly and read not at all, the desk clerk translated for me and helped draft an answer in Chinese. After departure on one occasion I received a phone call on my mobile from the housekeeping staff which had found a name and telephone number I had written on a slip of paper and left behind. They wanted to make sure that I hadn't lost an important piece of information. This seems to me to be service above and beyond what can normally be expected. I give the staff the very highest marks possible. I will be returning to this area every couple of months for the indefinite future and intend to return to this hotel every time.

Reviews.Title: “better value than Manhatten”
Reviews.Author: gs89
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind the 30 minute subway ride to Manhatten, this hotel is a good value. We paid $113 US per night. Lobby was clean, room was clean and washroom clean. Bed is comfortable to sleep, cleaning staff did a great job. Subway station was a block away, along with shops and Chinese / Korean restaurants area. Chinese food was great nearby. Only disappointment was the Free Breakfast. We suggest going out to the nearby Burger King for breakfast as better selection and price value meals. Sure will stay here again and recommend this hotel for family/friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: tlmy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel overnight when we came into the city for a Mets game and sightseeing trip. We had no problems with the room or the staff. We were allowed check our bags and car ($10 in guarded lot across the street) in early so we could head into the city without any problem. When we returned later that night the staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was clean and more than big enough for two adults and two children. We did have the free breakfast in the morning which consisted of bagels, cereal and fruit- it is free so I felt that it was more than adequate. The checkout process was very easy and without incident. The staff spoke english well enough that we didn't have a problem understanding them. In regards to the area- we knew before we booked that the hotel was outside of the city and in the middle of Flushing's China Town...we never felt that we or are children were unsafe or in any danger and actually enjoyed the area. The subway station is a little over a block from the hotel and very easy to figure out. The 7 train starts/ends at this station and starts/ends at Times Square with stops on 5th Ave and Grand Central so getting to the main sight seeing areas via stops or connections with other trains was very easy. Also- the hotel is one stop away from Citifield...a big plus for us. If you want a hotel that is MUCH cheaper than one you would find in the city and don't mind managing the subway this is the hotel for you. We will be staying there again for our next trip to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Poor excuse of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: dpw369
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights; I went on a sightseeing trip to New York with my family. Unfortunately I left booking a hotel late so I had to stay in this hole. If you are on sightseeing in Manhattan don’t stay here as it takes around 40 minutes on the subway to get there. Anyway here are the main problems. 1. Rip off at $200 a night. 2. In a crap area. 3. Staff are very unfriendly, rude and speak little English. 4. Rooms are small even by New York standards. 5. Breakfast is poor too. Don’t stay here unless you want to be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Chinese Speakers Only”
Reviews.Author: savvy11
Reviews.Content: If you speak Cantonese - you will get a good room and have a pleasant sleep in this hotel. If not - non-Chinese speakers will have a very hard time here as almost nobody will speak English with you. While in the hotel I helped several guests who needed help. The room itself was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: daria57
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel one night on business. I travel a lot and have had to put up with some not so good places, but I have never felt the need to write a review. When I asked for a recommendation for dinner, the front desk clerk got an attitude like "why are you bothering me?" and told me there are restaurants up and down the street - pick one. The room was tiny with barely enough room to get around the bed and cost 200 bucks! Several lightbulbs were burned out so I couldn't do any work at the desk comfortably and there was no clock in the room although there were directions on how to use it in the hotel directory. I had to literally crawl under the desk to get to the plug which was the only accessable plug in the room. I found wrappers from previous occupant in the room so it had not been thoroughly cleaned. The breakfast was a joke and the breakfast room was dirty. On check out I left the comment card with my negative comments. Several hours later I get a voicemail on my cell informing me that housekeeping told them that I had broken the coffeepot and I would be charged for it. I did not break the coffeepot and feel that this is retaliation for my negative review. Do yourself a favor and stay away. Yuck!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: seafoam
Reviews.Content: Two of us were planning to attend the US Open and had booked this hotel for it's location; 1 1/2 block to subway and then - Only one stop from Billie Jean King Tennis Center! so it literally only took about a 3 minute subway ride instead of 45 minutes from Manhattan. I was concered about the hotel and location, but that turned out to be useless worrying. Nothing fancy, no architetural monument, but the hotel is super clean, bathrooms modern, Kohler fixtures, had a continental breakfast and surrounded by restaurants. Yes, there was even a Burger King and a McDonalds in Chinatown. Bar area was not open. Front desk was very courteous and efficient. Taxi was $15 from LGA. Will stay there next year for the Open!

Reviews.Title: “Had Bad Experience”
Reviews.Author: scuchief
Reviews.Content: I had a terrible experience with this hotel. My son and I were booked in a room; and, when another "couple" joined us for the next couple days, they relocated us to another room without informing us. When asked about the reason for the change of rooms, we were told that we didn't make the changes on the computer. We mentioned to them that I had called (before the trip) the 1-800 number to Best Western directly and had Best Western change the occupancy from 2 to 4 after the first night (and was assured that it was done as requested). They moved us to a "smoking" room, a room that had no screen on the window (so it was not advisable to open the window), and a bathroom with a fan not working. (A screen was put on the window after 1 1/2 days.)

Reviews.Title: “Beware- Check your bill statement”
Reviews.Author: bstartrek
Reviews.Content: I had problems with the 45 min check in process. Although I showed them my Best Western confirmation, they were going to charge a higher rate. On the 2nd day, they said that we had 2 rooms and was going to charge me for the second room. They would NOT allow me to use their lobby phone to call 1-800 western. After 30 mins on the phone, I showed the front desk THIER mistake. On the 3rd day, they deactivated our room key and thought we were suppose to check out When I wanted to use the restroom one floor below, they asked that I go back to our own room. The only positive thing I would mention about this hotel is its location location location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: baseballfan08
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we needed a reasonably priced hotel in a safe area. We had been advised that this area was safe and convenient to the subway. We found this to be true. We were traveling with our young children and were very pleased with the hotel. Our room was very quite and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for visit to New York”
Reviews.Author: Buckeye582
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights in Oct. 2007. The hotel is clean, quiet, 2 blocks from subway station. Very safe neighborhood, in the heart of Flushings Chinatown. Many restaurants nearby. $16 taxi ride to LGA (10 minutes). Helpful and friendly staff. Subway line #7 goes to Grand Central and Times Square ( 20 minute ride). Breakfast was standard fare, nothing special. Parking $10 per night, across the street. Nice place to access Manhattan without paying Manhattan hotel prices.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I had not chosen this one :(”
Reviews.Author: Zach76
Reviews.Content: I was on vacation with my wife and in-laws in NY. I chose this place due to the proximity to the bus tour start location. I thoroughly repented choosing this location as soon as I entered the lobby.. they had filthy disgusting stained furniture. The customer service at the front desk was awful..I was checking in and the lady after starting to attend took a phone call and had me waiting there for about 20-30 min. She did not even apologize..I was waiting there for so long for something that took her less than a minute to do.. create the electronic room keys. The whole place had this awful smell. The continental breakfast was an excuse..I would suggest that they should not provide. Don't bother wasting your time having the complimentary breakfast. Believe me you would be better off paying couple of dollars at McDonald or Burger King. Everything thing wasn't bad.. Thankfully the rooms were clean. I was so frustrated with the experience that ruined my vacation..A good night sleep is very important during a vacation. I think I learned my lesson..I will would rather spend more than stay at this cheap hotel. Do yourself a favor... NEVER STAY at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Walked to Shea Stadium”
Reviews.Author: ATLAS313
Reviews.Content: I stayed here weekend of June 1st. Positives: Close to Subway line #7 (2 blocks) Price was reasonable Room was clean; fairly quiet Staff was friendly Internet access in lobby Negatives: Location is in heart of Chinatown so if that has no allure then don't stay here Air Conditioning is on or off. I have been recently spoiled by climate controlled rooms. Runs all night Continental breakfast is pretty sparse.

Reviews.Title: “Great value near Shea Stadium”
Reviews.Author: pawwap
Reviews.Content: The Queens Court is a great value near Shea Stadium. It is a block and a half from Subway (line 7) and walkable to Shea. The hotel is clean, well run and seemed in a safe section of Chinese Flushing New York. About 10 minutes cab ride to LaGuardia. We found that the hotel was a fine place to stay for getting quickly into Manhattan and for seeing a ballgame. We had no problems and the price was very resonable for NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Close to everything.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 days and had a great time. The rooms were clean and much bigger than most hotels for the price. There could have been more cable channels but not bad. Right next to the Flushing Mall, and many great restaurants. We Would and will go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed my stay at the Queens Court Hotel, Flushing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well run hotel, bedroom spacious, bright, bathroom excellent. Breakfast average, not what an Irish person is used to ! Would stay there again and would recommend it to travellers to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just stayed for 6 nights at this hotel. We think it a good decision: reasonable price, friendly, efficient staff, clean and spacious rooms, free internet access, situated in the very heart of Chinatown in Flushing, at short walking distance from subway nr 7 Mainstreet Station (to Manhattan Grand Central) and from Long Island Rail Road to Manhattan Penn station (ride takes only 17 minutes). Breakfast was however, for European standards, rather simple though sufficient.
